content: uk terms in partnership with droplet mug rug crochet a coaster and help wateraid show uk policy-makers that you want action for clean water for all wateraid is asking people to create their own special mug rug following this simple crochet pattern of a water droplet they will share your coasters with mps and ministers during a day of action for water in westminster later in the year by crocheting your coaster you can show our elected representatives that their constituents are willing to dedicate their time for clean water send your completed mug rug to campaigns team wateraid 6th floor 20 canada square london e14 5nn materials required you can use any sport weight / dk yarn you wish however if you are going to stand hot items on your mug rug i would recommend you stick to natural fibres such as cotton or bamboo as manmade fibres like acrylic may melt if they come into contact with heat i used stylecraft naturals bamboo + cotton 60% bamboo / 40% cotton 250m per 100g ball 7g in deep sea 7252 mc 6g in chalk 7127 cc 3 mm hook gauge / gauge finished mug rug 23 sts x 19 row measures 10 5 cm x 10 cm using stylecraft naturals bamboo + cotton and a 3 mm hook abbreviations chain chain fo fasten_off double_crochet double_crochet stdc standing double_crochet bldc double_crochet in back loop only fltr2d treble in front loop 2 row down 1 © rosina plane www rosinaplane com uk terms in partnership with about mosaic crochet this design uses the overlay mosaic crochet technique all stitches are worked on the right side so yarn is cut at the end of each row the base fabric is made up of row of back loop dcs and the pattern is created by working trebles into the unused front loops 2 row below there are no mid-row colour changes change colour every row the colour required for each row is stated at the start of the written instructions for that row if you are new to this technique don t worry it is much easier than it looks and i have recorded a short video for the first few row to get you started this can be viewed on my youtube channel at righthanded https //youtu be/tstr_xxy8ps lefthanded https //youtu be/9c7kcllnm40 if you are familiar with the technique and prefer to use a chart i have also attached this over the page written instructions row 1 mc make 23 chain fo working into the back bump of the chains 1 stdc in first chain 22
